body:
Romans 8:38-39: "For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord."

God loves you.
body_html:
Romans 8:38-39: "For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord."

God loves you.
title: Even when you hate yourself

body:
God wants you to admit you’re a sinner. He wants to love you. 

Only the devil wants you to hate yourself. Don’t succumb to that temptation- it leads to death and hell. 

Believe that Jesus chose you specifically to save because you matter to Him.
body_html:
God wants you to admit you’re a sinner. He wants to love you.

Only the devil wants you to hate yourself. Don’t succumb to that temptation- it leads to death and hell.

Believe that Jesus chose you specifically to save because you matter to Him.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.title: Even when you hate yourself

body:
>God wants you to admit you’re a sinner. He wants to love you.

Why would God want someone to confess to intrinsic sinfulness? That doesn't even make sense, and is like confessing water is wet. It's also not a concept found in any NT scripture, only in American Evangelical Christianity.

body: It's literally in John's baptism, the parable of the pharisee and the tax collector, the thief on the cross, the immoral catamite, and basically every single place in the gospels. And in the old testament too. The people who were condemned were the ones who falsely thought they were righteous and glorious by their own accord and refused to humble themselves.
body_html: It's literally in John's baptism, the parable of the pharisee and the tax collector, the thief on the cross, the immoral catamite, and basically every single place in the gospels. And in the old testament too. The people who were condemned were the ones who falsely thought they were righteous and glorious by their own accord and refused to humble themselves.

body: No, polytheist, the idea of confessing for sin is in the NT, never confessing intrinsic sinfulness according to the Pauline-Augustine-Calvinistic pipeline of original sin. That's once again Christians perverting even their own scripture.

body: You think you don't, polytheist. That's the point. You're still a trinitarian, even if you don't know how it's defined or what you worship. The Nicene theology. (But didn't you confess modalism/Sabellianism too, I can't quite recall. Not like you would know the difference anyway.) Do you also believe Jesus is fully God and fully man? That's the Chalcedonian definition. And who compiled and canonized your Bible? You wouldn't know that either.
body_html: You think you don't, polytheist. That's the point. You're still a trinitarian, even if you don't know how it's defined or what you worship. The Nicene theology. (But didn't you confess modalism/Sabellianism too, I can't quite recall. Not like you would know the difference anyway.) Do you also believe Jesus is fully God and fully man? That's the Chalcedonian definition. And who compiled and canonized your Bible? You wouldn't know that either.

Romans 8:38-39: "For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord."

God loves you.
post.body_html:
Romans 8:38-39: "For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord."

post.title: Even when you hate yourself

body: Amazing, you can Google, but the canon wasn't officially closed until the Council of Trent, polytheist, after the start of the Reformation. And it was indeed based on Pope Damasus' list, and the Vulgata he commissioned Jerome with. But what's your canon based on, polytheist? What's its foundation? Nothing is the answer. And what you possibly know about forgeries?! Lmao.
body_html: Amazing, you can Google, but the canon wasn't officially closed until the Council of Trent, polytheist, after the start of the Reformation. And it was indeed based on Pope Damasus' list, and the Vulgata he commissioned Jerome with. But what's your canon based on, polytheist? What's its foundation? Nothing is the answer. And what you possibly know about forgeries?! Lmao.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
